rationales.power: He wants relatives to recognize him as a person with authority, not a kid running errands.
rationales.achievement: He emphasizes growth signals like expanding drivers and closing new restaurant deals.

rationales.power: He insists on personally absorbing schedule disruptions and struggles to step out of the center.
Even after winning the deal, what bothers him most is not being treated as the decision-maker.
rationales.achievement: He still secures the contract through pricing and persistence.
He tracks targets, keeps all scooters running, and rewards riders for hitting goals.
rationales.power: He chooses to stay in active oversight because he wants direct control over operations.
rationales.hedonism: He declines leisure with friends to remain in management mode.

rationales.tradition: He agrees to help in his father's shop as expected family duty.
rationales.power: In that space he feels reduced to a subordinate role and stripped of the status he seeks.

rationales.achievement: A rider quitting immediately harms routes and income, undermining business progress.
rationales.power: He experiences the resignation as loss of control over people he invested in.
He selects and shapes recruits according to his own leadership criteria.
rationales.achievement: His hiring focus is on people who will push output and growth.

rationales.power: Nader's no-show leaves him unable to enforce reliability, exposing weak control.
rationales.achievement: Covering an entire missed route in bad weather reflects operational setback.

rationales.power: He explicitly ties self-worth to being respected and being at the center of decisions.
rationales.self_direction: He rejects conforming to family-prescribed life paths and insists on defining his own.

rationales.achievement: Hiring Issa stabilizes execution and produces a reliable first full week.
rationales.security: He starts valuing steady dependability over high-variance hustle.
rationales.power: He acknowledges that results can hold even when he is not controlling every route.
